result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie James Evans III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: COUNTS 1 & 3: Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay surcharge. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Cash bail applied.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AFTER serving 2 years of Initial Confinement time.
Concurrent with: Federal sentence currently being served; with 5 days credit. *03-20-2018 Amended.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal controlled substances.

- Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
- Cooperate with random screening.

- AODA programs or treatment as recommended.
- Cooperate with random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the statute and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

If the defendant possess a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: COUNT 1 and Federal sentence currently being served; with 5 days credit. *03-20-2018 Amended.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant.

Defendant Willie James Evans in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Defendant Willie James Evans in custody.  
Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Hearing proceed.
 
Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the statute and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

COUNT 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 10 years with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to federal sentence currently being served -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5 years

COUNT 3:  COUR ORDERS defendant to serve 6 Months in the House of Correction with 3 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 1 and federal sentence currently being served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegal controlled substances; 5) cooperate with random screening; 6) seek and maintain legitimate employment.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AFTER serving 2 years of Initial Confinement time.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay surcharge
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds
-  pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection 

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed, and read in.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/12/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order signed and filed.  
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
